posts.body:
>>354a3fa8-f919-4d46-8138-919901cdb862
That's fine, too, but I'll be damned if I'm going to play Vintage. That shit is infested with discord niggers.

>>40aaf98e-27d3-4dfe-b3d4-b0f154a173eb
What "money generation"? Abusing the arena by savescumming when someone misses when you don't expect them to or gets a crit? That won't solve all money problems, but it takes care of most. 

>Arya isn't hard in the slightest to figure out really
Ah yes m'lord, thou art a gamer most grand and most omnipotent, scarce are the games that can put a dent in thine unbending will and intellect, m'lord. Your brute strength is only challenged by thine own honesty and the fact you never lie, especially when it comes to bragging on the internet - which you totally don't do, m'lord! 

>No i have no idea
Chapter 10, Ishtar and a buffed Julius chase you down until one of your units die. 

I don't understand where you get off from all this, by the way. Granted, I don't remember if I chose to play hard mode or normal mode, but you aren't currying any favor here by saying FE4 is 'easy'

>>3f62ab39-7aa5-48e3-9ae4-20c50758e53e
So basically a server?

>>e914801d-425c-40ed-9223-c4ac17ec8feb
It's pretty damn easy, even moreso than Sacred Stones, I'd say - and I'm playing on hard mode (the harder difficulties don't unlock until your second playthrough). 
The maps are pretty uninspired and make me wish they went back to the fuckhueg maps of the pre-DS era. 

The story, however, is quite nice, and I do appreciate the in-between moments. That doesn't say much for the battling, though. Plus, they have "certification tests" your "students" must pass before they can become a class, but one thing that really pisses me off is that you need to be skilled in a specific doctrine to pass the test just to ride a horse or a pegasus or a wyvern. You cannot, for example, be a male and have a pegasus. You just can't until the level 30 master class where you ''can'' be a male pegasus rider, but only if you are proficient in flying, lance, and sword. You can't be a bow-wielding or magic-casting flyer. Period. You can't even fucking use magic when on a flying mount, it doesn't give you the option. Was very disappointed with that.

>>833128cd-fab2-402a-90f6-dc666d97bcd5
How come we can never seem to escape fucking newfags who clearly don't know their fucking place and don't know how to fit in? Even in this fucking bunker far disassociated with Mark's hellhole (which I just looked into the other day - it's as bad as you can imagine. Just think of every discord spic spouting memes and defending Mark while all of a sudden pretending like they always hated Hotwheels despite loving him and being clueless to his true self just days/weeks prior. It's fucking pathetic. You can also smell the crossposters on the wind like an ill omen)

Just proves even more that there is/was a cabal of board owners working in a similar fashion to 4chan where it's less about sovereign "islands" (boards) having their own authority that doesn't extend beyond their own land and more about a "conglomerate" of islands like the League of Nations or the UN. 

Even back when Kikewheels was Admin, he was best buds with Mark, the previous owner of /tv/, the turkroach of /pol/, and the original /int/ owner (who got BTFO'd)

Let it be known that this anon hates secret societies who have as little transparency as possible.

>>d50364c3-a168-4b29-b33a-21c500192355
>Then I realized that most of my posts on /v/ within the past 2-3 years were attempts to get Mark to kill himself and I realize that maybe I don't care about conversing with other people about video games anymore

I think the issue is that you prefer to lurk rather than post but the problem of moderation got so bad that the only times you are so bothered to post is when Mark is involved - that's how bad things have become. That says more about /v/'s moderation than it does you.

>>04a80a31-f739-4b2f-b1ce-8438b285bb2f
What are you on about? Precious metals will always have intrinsic value as long as humans are the ones doing the dealing. There's a reason currencies period began with them. People like shiny, heavy things, and gold/silver is just that. While it may not have a specific number value (e.g. $20/oz or something) it is a universally accepted method of payment for services rendered/goods. Far more than trading, say, a cow or a chicken. 

How many chickens or goats can you say a house is truly worth?

>>cfbf6afc-b832-4494-bc45-ca9604bdfc12
If this is true, then there's no reason to return to 8chan ever again. I just wanted freedom, that's all. But apparently freedom is too much to ask for.

posts.body:
>>f642849f-56c6-4486-8fbc-1ea6e4cfe7fc
True, but it cannot be stressed enough how different those times were. Can't forget what 2007 did to the world wide web.

I'll be honest, man. I don't know what to do to fix things. While I do think the website, 8chan for instance, could use new people, I think there ought to be a proper vetting method to separate the chaff from the ones with potential. 

One could argue that the clearnet has lost its mystery that it had about 15 years ago. There was a high enough barrier to entry that kept smooth brains out - for the most part. Now that barrier is gone. Perhaps the "mystery" and "danger" of the darknet serves as a worthy fortress for 08chan. I just wonder if the normalfag invasion will ever extend this far.

>>d786dce0-178d-4153-8e92-77e6ccfd7e05
What the fuck are you on about? That's an awful idea. Are you a fucking retard, dude? Do you want the same people who took down 8chan to come and flood this place and start subverting it like what's been going on in the Cake Kike's half-assed "bunker"? 

Oh, who am I kidding, you're one of them, so of course you don't care.

Short answer? Valve had the funny idea of making lootboxes (the very first if I'm not mistaken) and they milked the fuck out of the idea and almost every other predatory business practice in the book, not to mention P2W shit at one point. Then they came upon the reasonable conclusion that they'd make more money if they made the game free - which they did, and it opened the floodgates, quite literally. All manner of shitskin, retard, child, and every other subhuman into the game, diluting the existing fanbase into a wave of shit. This only worsened with the Meet your Match update which may well have just removed community servers from the game - this means that the creation and sustenance of tight-knit sub-communities of the game could not exist, since the only 'community' these newfags would ever have with the new matchmaking are 29 other random people they have little to no contact with socially and will likely never see again once the round/game is over. 

Ironically, you get more of a community sense from trade servers of all things. But yeah, tl;dr is that Valve went for money rather than substance and TF2 just had to be their guinea pig for testing the waters of how many shitty business practices will a community of paypigs and retards take (the answer: a lot)

>>029c152a-adc7-4017-a0a2-15b4421eebcf
I personally consider Engineer update-era TF2 to be the golden age. Had all the class weapons, minimal cosmetics, and none of the trading/micro-transaction bullshit.
I'd like to see more frequent updates. One average-sized update every 4 months is fucking unacceptable

>3,000 Euros every day up to six months
Who wants to bet Valve will end up allowing Frogs to resell games instead of tanking this comparably miserly amount? They probably make millions in revenue every month and the few hundred thousand they're fined is nothing. Fucking kikes.

>>9de47a6e-c3c8-4aa2-842e-0c7c0252d28a
Loli is a bodytype, you nigger. A significant amount of loli doujins have lolis who don't act, look, or talk like actual children. You'd get more of a realistic child out of toddlercon - which is, from my opinion, far closer to pedophilia than loli.

>>e872a54c-483f-4389-babf-965388f25ef1
>a drawing of a 1000yo vampire in the form of a child fucking is still ficitonal child porn
Uh, no, it isn't, you smooth-brained retard. 

There's a lot wrong with your post but I haven't the time to go through every minutiae. I'll start with the fact that child porn only applies to REAL children, whereas a doujin is entirely hand-drawn, and thus not child porn, as it accomplished none of the things that child porn does except for getting someone erect. 
Secondly, a 1000yo vampire (a lolibaba) wouldn't talk like or behave like a real child - that is true for most loli's out there but doesn't apply to all of them. They'd also probably look nothing like a real life child unless it's a specific artist who excels in realism - think the UnterAlterBach artist. 

So this all draws back to how I said that loli is a body type, not an age.

>>4a19675f-dbe7-46b0-8e85-3cf14bde9892
You've got a lot to learn, nigger.
>Implying Mark has the technical skills to make such a website - he could hardly even moderate a board
>Implying Mark wouldn't namefag like crazy if he were here at all
>implying this place wouldn't be overrun by discord spics and other such "memers" if he were in charge (cause he's friends with them so he'd invite them over)

For your own sanity, and because I don't trust you, I do not dare link it. Suffice it to say that he has rules implemented so that "political talk" isn't allowed. Remind yourself that he is technically hired by Jim, and, being a boomer faggot cuckservative who buckles at opposition, probably asked Mark that he make the rules as such, and Mark, being the limp-wristed blowhard kike that he is, agreed fully.

>>48df2ebf-7faf-4f4d-bc6c-8b75d822ef1f
It's also worth noting how slow technological progress has become. I really don't even know who to blame for that, or ''what'' to blame. Is it the niggers and low-IQ retards who are somehow allowed into college (and subsequently achieve nothing)? Is it the diversity quotas in both universities and places of research/work? Is it from the general zeitgeist of the modern era where people really aren't allowed to speak for themselves and instead must constantly walk on eggshells lest they be ousted? I'd love to place some blame on the fact that people are more concerned with bread and circuses than they are science and God.

>>073c4a1d-52ee-4a36-80a7-78799445338a
> and the very few that linger among us seem to be very kind and the good posters,
Not sure whether or not to agree with you on that point. It could also be the fact that one's post history is easily accessible is making the usual shitposters/undesirables to start walking on eggshells with their posts. But I also feel like said people would have left for Mark's bunker since it's relatively busier there, feels safer, and is friendlier to retards. 

I've said it once and I'll say it again, this place's only glaring problem is lack of bodies. But you can't just go advertising the place willy-nilly, else you invite over more newfags, shills, and FBI niggers. 8chan will come back up eventually, even if it takes several more months. It will likely be horribly gimped and censored, however. Even in the event that it isn't changed on the surface, there are tons of shit to worry about underneath, effectively making the site unusable. 

With all that said, I think it's worth a shot telling people about this "bunker" on 8chan once it comes back up. It doesn't even matter if Mark's bitch ass finds out and comes here. The important part is that he has no power, and that goes for Jim as well.

>>4cd5b0b0-ace0-4c81-b225-8e007e1b4f80
>In what aspects, and as compared to what?
You can think of this in a very simple way and just bring up how there are few technological innovations like what was seen pre-Cold War. You could argue that the innovations stopped earlier, like following the end of the second World War, but I'm working under the assumption that the Moon landing was real. Speaking of, ask yourself why we were able to put a man on the moon about 50 years ago but nowadays we have trouble even getting an unmanned spacecraft into orbit, let alone the moon. 

Also keep in mind how the more technology 'progresses', the more things stay the same. Smart phones, for instance, are becoming way too similar. They're doing the opposite of forking, and are instead 'merging' into one gadget. What's the next innovation? Uhh, a new camera lens! What about for game consoles? Well, we're making it stream stuff better (not really)! 

Remember that Steve Jobs interview? I'd be surprised if you haven't seen it already. He was right. Sure, he said that when Apple was much smaller than what it is today, and the problem he was describing, one could argue, is something only the big corporations experience and not the smaller fish fighting over scraps. Keep in mind, however, that the majority of the money flow for each industry goes to those big corporations, and they more often than not set the standard. A real innovator and entrepreneur could make it to the top and create serious waves, but I haven't seen or heard of any such major breakthroughs. 

Really, think back into recent years and tell me what "good" has been developed in recent years that has made a major impact and ended up being financially successful? Virtual Reality? That can't be said to have even lifted off yet, and to say it's been a financial success is a stretch. I'd even say we're going backwards with Virtual Reality rather than forwards. 

Also, regarding your reply to 4383's thoughts on GUI's and shit - I think you got the wrong idea. Suffice it to say that there's a big difference between making things more convenient to save the user's time and blatantly obscuring settings/files/etc preventing you from making changes to your hardware. Proprietary software, basically. You have to install iTunes and go through a ton of elaborate steps just to make a custom ringtone on your iPhone these days. You can see what he's talking about if you work with Windows 10 and Windows 7 computers as well.

>>5dda141d-5cbd-4630-af2f-ca93f9e90b2b
Because freedom is a dangerous thing to those in power. Haven't you noticed from lurking /v/ for so long that posters think in a much different way than your run-of-the-mill normalfags (keep in mind how the term normalfag came to be, as well)? The big meme, of course, is that /v/ is pessimistic as hell and hates vidya, but in reality, I haven't seen any community more passionate about video games. Passion isn't something to be ashamed of, either, as much as normalfags want to shame you and I for liking something and wishing it the best,  especially something as """"nerdy"""" as PC gaming. Because /v/-goers are so passionate, they are far more keen to decline than most others who lack such passion and eat whatever shit is put on their plates. 

Anyways, my point is that it's no coincidence that you and I are being shoved out of our hobby and kept away from discussion of it. Face it, we're dangerous. Make of that as you will.

>>684cbc36-d9b8-47e5-97cd-5cf8610e94e5
It's almost a good thing the sadpanda shutdown happened before 8chan went under. Taught a lot of users, I'm sure, of the importance of archiving and saving.
